title: Teaching
body:
I currently teach classes on programming for art and music at Louisiana State University and Liberty Magnet High School (Formerly known as Lee Magnet High School) in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. Many of these classes were developed as part of the [LSU Stem Certification Pathways](https://lsupathways.org), which provides curriculum development and teacher training. The open source curriculum is linked below.    

## College
### Spring 2020
* [CSC 2463](https://github.com/tatecarson/LSU-PDM-Spring-2020) – Programming Digital Media, Instructor, Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, LA
* MUS 4744 – Mobile Music, Teaching Assistant, Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, LA

### Spring 2019
* [CSC 2463](https://github.com/tatecarson/LSU-PDM-Spring-2019) – Programming Digital Media, Instructor, Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, LA

### Spring 2018
* [CSC 2463](https://github.com/tatecarson/LSU-PDM-Spring-2018) – Programming Digital Media, Instructor, Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, LA

## Highschool
### 2019-20
* [Coding for the Web](https://coding-for-the-web.lsupathways.org/), Lee Magnet High School, Baton Rouge, LA

### Fall and Spring 2019
* [Introduction to Computational Thinking](https://intro-to-computational-thinking.lsupathways.org/), Lee Magnet High School, Baton Rouge, LA

### Spring 2018
* [CSC 2463](https://github.com/tatecarson/LSU-PDM-Spring-2018) – Programming Digital Media, Lee Magnet High School, Baton Rouge, LA
